slides.title: Liquidity Ratios
slides.content:
# Liquidity Analysis

## Key Ratios

| Ratio | Formula |
|-------|--------|
| Current | CA / CL |
| Quick | (CA - Inventory) / CL |
| Cash | Cash / CL |

## Interpretation

| Ratio | Good Range |
|-------|------------|
| Current | 1.5 - 2.0 |
| Quick | 1.0 or higher |

## Working Capital

```
Working Capital = Current Assets - Current Liabilities

Indicates short-term financial health
```

slides.title: Efficiency Ratios
slides.content:
# Activity Ratios

## Asset Turnover

| Ratio | Formula |
|-------|--------|
| Asset turnover | Sales / Total Assets |
| Receivables turnover | Sales / Avg Receivables |
| Inventory turnover | COGS / Avg Inventory |
| Payables turnover | COGS / Avg Payables |

## Days Calculations

```
Days Sales Outstanding = 365 / Receivables Turnover

Days Inventory = 365 / Inventory Turnover

Days Payables = 365 / Payables Turnover
```

## Cash Conversion Cycle

```
DSO + Days Inventory - Days Payables
= Cash Conversion Cycle
```

slides.quizQuestion: The quick ratio excludes which current asset?

slides.title: Profitability Ratios
slides.content:
# Profitability Analysis

## Margin Ratios

| Ratio | Formula |
|-------|--------|
| Gross margin | GP / Sales |
| Operating margin | Operating Income / Sales |
| Net margin | Net Income / Sales |

## Return Ratios

| Ratio | Formula |
|-------|--------|
| ROA | Net Income / Avg Assets |
| ROE | Net Income / Avg Equity |
| ROCE | EBIT / Capital Employed |

## DuPont Analysis

```
ROE = Net Margin x Asset Turnover x Equity Multiplier
    = (NI/Sales) x (Sales/Assets) x (Assets/Equity)
```

slides.title: Leverage Ratios
slides.content:
# Financial Leverage

## Debt Ratios

| Ratio | Formula |
|-------|--------|
| Debt to equity | Total Debt / Total Equity |
| Debt ratio | Total Debt / Total Assets |
| Equity ratio | Total Equity / Total Assets |

## Coverage Ratios

| Ratio | Formula |
|-------|--------|
| Interest coverage | EBIT / Interest Expense |
| Debt service | EBITDA / (Interest + Principal) |

## Interpretation

| High Leverage | Low Leverage |
|---------------|---------------|
| Higher risk | Lower risk |
| Magnifies returns | Stable returns |
| Fixed obligations | Flexibility |

slides.title: Market Ratios
slides.content:
# Market Value Ratios

## Per Share Metrics

| Ratio | Formula |
|-------|--------|
| EPS | Net Income / Shares |
| Book value/share | Equity / Shares |
| Dividends/share | Dividends / Shares |

## Valuation Ratios

| Ratio | Formula |
|-------|--------|
| P/E ratio | Price / EPS |
| Price/Book | Price / Book Value |
| Dividend yield | DPS / Price |

## Interpretation

| High P/E | Low P/E |
|----------|--------|
| Growth expected | Value stock |
| Expensive | Cheap |

slides.title: Profitability Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: DuPont analysis breaks ROE into how many components?

slides.title: Trend Analysis
slides.content:
# Horizontal Analysis

## Year-over-Year

```
Change = Current Year - Prior Year

% Change = Change / Prior Year x 100
```

## Base Year Analysis

```
Index = Current Year / Base Year x 100

Shows cumulative change from base
```

## Considerations

| Factor | Impact |
|--------|--------|
| Inflation | Distorts comparison |
| Restructuring | One-time effects |
| Acquisitions | Growth distortion |

slides.title: Common Size Analysis
slides.content:
# Vertical Analysis

## Income Statement

```
Each item as % of Sales

Example:
Gross Profit = GP / Sales x 100
```

## Balance Sheet

```
Each item as % of Total Assets

Example:
Cash = Cash / Total Assets x 100
```

## Benefits

| Benefit | Application |
|---------|-------------|
| Comparability | Different size companies |
| Structure | See composition |
| Benchmarking | Industry comparison |

slides.title: Quality of Earnings
slides.content:
# Earnings Quality

## Indicators

| High Quality | Low Quality |
|--------------|-------------|
| Cash-backed | Accrual-heavy |
| Recurring | One-time items |
| Conservative | Aggressive |

## Cash Flow Analysis

```
Cash from operations vs Net income

Healthy: CFO > NI
Concern: CFO << NI
```

## Red Flags

| Warning | Implication |
|---------|-------------|
| Growing receivables | Collection issues |
| Declining margins | Competition |
| Increasing liabilities | Financial stress |

slides.title: Valuation Methods
slides.content:
# Business Valuation

## Approaches

| Approach | Methods |
|----------|--------|
| Income | DCF, Capitalized earnings |
| Market | Comparables, multiples |
| Asset | Book value, liquidation |

## DCF Valuation

```
Value = Sum of PV of Future Cash Flows

PV = CF / (1 + r)^n
```

## Market Multiples

| Multiple | Formula |
|----------|--------|
| EV/EBITDA | Enterprise Value / EBITDA |
| P/E | Price / Earnings |
| P/S | Price / Sales |

slides.title: Industry Analysis
slides.content:
# Comparative Analysis

## Benchmarking

| Compare To | Purpose |
|------------|--------|
| Industry average | Positioning |
| Competitors | Direct comparison |
| Best in class | Target setting |

## Industry Factors

| Factor | Consideration |
|--------|---------------|
| Life cycle | Growth stage |
| Competition | Market structure |
| Regulation | Constraints |
| Technology | Disruption |

slides.title: Cash Flow Analysis
slides.content:
# Cash Flow Health

## Quality Indicators

| Pattern | Interpretation |
|---------|---------------|
| +CFO, -CFI, -CFF | Healthy growth |
| +CFO, +CFI, -CFF | Asset sales |
| -CFO, +CFI, +CFF | Financing growth |

## Free Cash Flow

```
Free Cash Flow = CFO - CapEx

Available for debt, dividends, growth
```

## Analysis Points

- Sustainability
- Working capital trends
- CapEx requirements
- Financing needs
